View source Improve this doc

ngBindHtml
directive in module ng

Description

Creates a binding that will innerHTML the result of evaluating the expression into the current element in a secure way. By default, the innerHTML-ed content will be sanitized using the $sanitize ***REMOVED***. To utilize this functionality, ensure that $sanitize is available, for example, by including ngSanitize in your module's dependencies (not in core Angular.) You may also byp***REMOVED*** sanitization for values you know are safe. To do so, bind to an explicitly trusted value via $sce.trustAsHtml. See the example under Strict Contextual Escaping (SCE).

Note: If a $sanitize ***REMOVED*** is unavailable and the bound value isn't explicitly trusted, you will have an exception (instead of an exploit.)

Usage

as attribute
<ANY ng-bind-html="{expression}">
   ...
</ANY>
as cl***REMOVED***
<ANY cl***REMOVED***="ng-bind-html: {expression};">
   ...
</ANY>

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
ngBindHtmlexpression

Expression to evaluate.
